obligations.text: The directive obliges large undertakings and listed SMEs to include sustainability information in their management report.
The directive obliges undertakings to report sustainability information in accordance with European Sustainability Reporting Standards.
The directive obliges undertakings to report sustainability information in accordance with European Sustainability Reporting Standards.
The directive obliges statutory auditors or audit firms to carry out assurance of reported sustainability information.
The regulation obliges undertakings within CSRD scope to disclose sustainability information as specified in the ESRS standards.
The regulation obliges undertakings subject to sustainability reporting to disclose information on how and to what extent their activities are environmentally sustainable.
The regulation obliges financial market participants to disclose taxonomy-related information for financial products.
The directive obliges companies within scope to conduct human rights and environmental due diligence.
The directive obliges companies to identify and assess actual and potential adverse impacts in their operations and value chains.
The directive obliges companies to prevent, mitigate, bring to an end, or minimise adverse impacts.
The regulation obliges economic operators to ensure batteries placed on the market comply with sustainability, safety, and labelling requirements.
The regulation obliges producers to collect and manage waste batteries in accordance with specified targets.
The regulation obliges economic operators to place on the market only packaging that complies with essential sustainability and waste-reduction requirements.
The regulation obliges Member States to ensure systems for packaging waste collection and treatment.
The regulation obliges financial market participants to disclose sustainability risks and impacts at entity and product level.
The regulation obliges financial advisers to disclose how sustainability risks are integrated into investment advice.
The regulation obliges operators to exercise due diligence before placing relevant commodities and products on the EU market or exporting them.
The regulation obliges operators to submit due-diligence statements demonstrating deforestation-free and legal production.
The regulation obliges importers to report embedded greenhouse-gas emissions for covered goods.
The regulation obliges authorised declarants to surrender CBAM certificates corresponding to embedded emissions.
The directive obliges employers to provide information on pay levels and pay gaps.
The directive obliges employers to report gender pay gap information where thresholds are met.
The regulation obliges economic operators not to place or make available products made with forced labour on the EU market.
The regulation obliges operators to cooperate with investigations and provide information to competent authorities.

The regulation obliges economic operators to ensure products can only be placed on the market or put into service if a digital product passport is available in accordance with applicable delegated acts.
The regulation obliges manufacturers to ensure the digital product passport includes product identification, sustainability information, and is accessible via a data carrier affixed to the product.
The regulation obliges manufacturers to assign a unique product identifier to each product unit or batch, linked to the digital product passport.

The regulation obliges manufacturers to ensure products comply with ecodesign requirements, prepare technical documentation, and ensure the digital product passport is available before placing products on the market.
